content: How do I generate a CSS stylesheet for a button element with specific style properties?

To generate a CSS stylesheet for a button element with specific style properties, you need to define the styles you want to apply to the button and then write the corresponding CSS rules. Here's a basic example of how you can style a button:

### Example Button Styles

Let's say you want to create a button with the following style properties:

- Background color: Blue
- Text color: White
- Padding: 10px 20px
- Border: None
- Border-radius: 5px
- Font-size: 16px
- Hover effect: Darker blue background

### CSS Stylesheet

You can write the following CSS in your stylesheet:

```css
/* Button Styles */
.button {
  background-color: blue;
  color: white;
  padding: 10px 20px;
  border: none;
  border-radius: 5px;
  font-size: 16px;
  cursor: pointer;
  transition: background-color 0.3s;
}

.button:hover {
  background-color: darkblue;
}
```

### HTML Example

To apply these styles to a button in your HTML, use the class attribute:

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="styles.css"> <!-- Link to your CSS file -->
    <title>Styled Button</title>
</head>
<body>
    <button class="button">Click Me</button>
</body>
</html>
```

### Explanation

- **`.button`**: This class applies the basic styles to the button.
- **Background color**: Set to blue for the default state.
- **Color**: White text color for contrast against the blue background.
- **Padding**: Provides space inside the button to make it look nicer.
- **Border**: Set to none to remove any default border styles.
- **Border-radius**: Makes the corners of the button rounded.
- **Font-size**: Sets the size of the button text.
- **Cursor**: Changes the cursor to a pointer when hovering over the button.
- **Transition**: Smoothens the change of background color on hover.
- **`:hover`**: Changes the background color to a darker blue when the user hovers over the button.

You can customize these styles to match your design preferences.
